eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking an object.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

propertyDescriptors.description: Should check hovering
propertyDescriptors.name: ShouldCheckHovering

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward an object.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward _PARAM5_ with speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward a position.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets in the direction of a given angle.
eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: When firing in a full circle, prevent first and last bullet from using the same angle

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a single bullet. This is only meant to be used inside the "Fire bullet" action.
eventsFunctions.name: FireSingleBullet
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire a single bullet _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: Move bullet (apply angle and bullet speed variances)
Add identifier variables (to enable advanced picking by users)
Rotate newly created bullet, if needed

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

propertyDescriptors.name: AngleVariance

propertyDescriptors.name: ExponentialCoolingRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer the bullets are created on
propertyDescriptors.description: Base layer by default.
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletLayer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

events.comment: Correct any values above maximum limits
Correct any values above maximum limits

events.name: Remove shield points if shield expired

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.description: current health points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Change the health points of the object. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the health of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

events.comment: If MaxHealth is set, prevent health from going above it

eventsFunctions.description: Change the health points of the object. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCurrentHealth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the health of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object by increasing its health points.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

events.comment: If Max Health is not set, do not enforce Max Health
If Max Health is set and Overhealing is not allowed

parameters.description: Points to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum health points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxHealth

events.comment: Make sure Current Health does not exceed new Max Health

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object maximum health points.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxHealth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum health of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: the rate of health regeneration (points per second).
eventsFunctions.name: HealthRegenRate

eventsFunctions.description: Change the rate of health regeneration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealthRegenRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the rate of health regen of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points per second

eventsFunctions.description: the duration of damage cooldown (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: DamageCooldownDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Change the duration of damage cooldown (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetCooldownDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the duration of damage cooldown on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the delay before health regeneration starts after last being hit (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: HealthRegenDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Change the delay before health regeneration starts after being hit.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealthRegenDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the health regeneration delay on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the chance to dodge incoming damage (range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: ChanceToDodge
eventsFunctions.sentence: the chance to dodge incoming damage

eventsFunctions.description: Change the chance to dodge incoming damage.
eventsFunctions.name: SetChanceToDodge
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the chance to dodge on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: the flat damage reduction from the armor. Incoming damage is reduced by this value.
eventsFunctions.name: FlatDamageReduction

eventsFunctions.name: SetFlatDamageReduction
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the flat damage reduction from armor on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.name: PercentDamageReduction

eventsFunctions.description: Change the percent damage reduction from armor. Range: 0 to 1.
eventsFunctions.name: SetPercentDamageReduction
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the percent damage reduction from armor on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Allow heals to increase health above max health.  Regeneration will not exceed max health.
eventsFunctions.name: AllowOverHealing

eventsFunctions.fullName: Mark object as hit at least once
eventsFunctions.name: SetHitAtLeastOnce
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mark _PARAM0_ as hit at least once: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points per second

eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Change delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration delay on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldBlockExcessDamage

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctions.description: Color tint applied to an object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Color tint applied to an object
eventsFunctions.name: ColorTint

events.comment: Return the color string for the tint applied to the object

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a color tint is applied to an object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Is a color tint applied to an object
eventsFunctions.name: IsTinted

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle an object effect.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleEffect

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle color tint between the starting tint and a given value.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleColorTint

events.name: Note: This function cannot be "public" until it properly handles objects without a starting color tint variable (NULL)
Swap between the starting tint and the given value

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle object visibility.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleVisibility

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time so it alternates between visible and invisible.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make an object flash (blink) visibility for a period of time.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the flashing, in seconds
parameters.longDescription: Use "0" to keep flashing until stopped.
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is flashing visibility.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop flashing visibility (blink) of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

eventsFunctions.description: the half period of the object (time the object is invisible).
eventsFunctions.name: HalfPeriodTime
eventsFunctions.sentence: the half period (time the object is invisible)

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period
propertyDescriptors.description: Time that the object is invisible
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

propertyDescriptors.label: Flash duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Use "0" to keep flashing until stopped
propertyDescriptors.name: FlashDuration
